content: Bike Map App

An app that provides safe bike routes for daily commuting, based on user's starting and ending location preferences. The routes are constantly updated by a team of local bikers who monitor and report on road conditions, construction and safety issues.
Route planning, real-time traffic updates, customizable preferences, safety ratings, community feedback
Google Maps, Apple Maps, Bikemap.net, Map My Ride, Ride with GPS

This app prioritizes safety and updates bike routes regularly by involving the community and local bikers. It also has customizable preferences for users based on their skill level, distance, and time preferences.
Bike Lane Installation

A one-person business that installs bike lanes in areas with high demand for safe cycling, partnering with local municipalities, businesses or communities to fund and execute the project. The service includes site evaluation, planning, materials sourcing, installation, and maintenance.
Site evaluation, planning, installation, maintenance, project management
Local bike shops, construction companies, municipalities, nonprofits

This service not only provides a solution to the bike lane problem but also creates an opportunity for local businesses or communities to support and invest in sustainable transportation. The service also includes ongoing maintenance to ensure the lanes are safe and functional.
Bike Share Program

A bike-sharing program designed for daily commuting, with a focus on safety, convenience, and affordability. The program provides users with access to a fleet of well-maintained bikes, strategically placed at key locations near public transportation hubs, business districts, and residential areas. The program also includes safety training, bike maintenance, and theft prevention measures.
Bike fleet management, safety training, maintenance, theft prevention, user-friendly interface
LimeBike, Ofo, Jump, Motivate, Spin

This bike-sharing program caters specifically to daily commuter needs, with a focus on safety and convenience. It also offers affordable pricing options and includes theft prevention measures to ensure the bikes are always available for users.
Bike Lane Activist

A one-person business that advocates for bike lane infrastructure and policies at the local, state, and federal levels. The service includes researching and analyzing bike lane data, engaging with policymakers and media outlets, organizing events and protests, and building partnerships with other bike lane advocacy groups.
Research and analysis, policy engagement, media relations, event planning, partnership building
Bike lane advocacy nonprofits, transportation research firms, consulting firms, advocacy agencies

This service addresses the root cause of the bike lane problem by advocating for comprehensive policy and infrastructure changes. It also creates a platform for civic engagement and community involvement, which can lead to long-term systemic changes.
pain_point_description: some commuters may prefer to bike to work as a healthy and eco-friendly alternative but struggle to find safe bike lanes
